title: How to Escape the Condemnation of Hell With the Bible

steps.headline: Pray constantly, so that you will not fall into temptation (St. Matthew chapter 26, verse 41).
Avoid committing the unforgivable sin.
steps.description: "Therefore I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven. And whoever says a word against the Son of man will be forgiven; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the age to come" (Matthew 12:22-32)". It is when a person denies the holy spirit to the point that their heart is hardened, that he can no longer hear the holy spirit. When the holy spirit talks to you and you cannot hear him because you rejected him to the point your heart is hardened, the holy spirit will leave you forever. Don't deny the holy spirit. Also, those that fear that they did commit blasphemy against holy spirit have not done so.

steps.headline: Follow the Beatitudes, as taught by Our Lord Jesus Christ.
steps.description: He summed up perfectly, on how to be righteous with Almighty God.(St. Matthew chapter 5.)

steps.headline: Always forgive the offences committed against you, by other people, so that God May Forgive you for your offences against Him.
Avoid hypocrisy, when choosing to follow the Ways of the Lord.
Help all those in need, as though you are helping Christ Himself.
Be Baptized in the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.
steps.description: (St. Matthew chapter 28.) That is how one becomes Born Again in Christ the Lord. (Gospel according to St. John, chapter 3.)

steps.headline: Bless the Virgin Mary, for God the Father, Has Chosen her to be The Mother of His Only Son.
Look upon a Cross, Crucifix, or even picture of Our Lord's Passion, to see the price He paid for you.
steps.description: (St. John chapter 3, as well as all 4 Gospels, concerning the Passion of Our Lord Jesus Christ, and His Resurrection.) Believe and proclaim your faith in Jesus's death on the cross for our sins and admit to the belief that He rose from the dead after three days. Believe that He will come again and give you eternal life.

steps.headline: Eat of the Flesh of the Son of God, and drink of His Blood.
As Our Lord was dying on the Cross, He gave over His Blessed Mother to be the Mother of His Apostle, John.
steps.description: Therefore, we should take Mary as our Mother too. (Gospel according to St. John, chapter 19.)

steps.headline: Confess your sins to the priest, so that they may be Forgiven by God.
steps.description: (Gospel according to St. John, chapter 20.) Turn away from your sins and ask for His strength to avoid the temptations of the world.

steps.headline: Avoid the sin of Fornication.
steps.description: Your body is the Temple of the Holy Spirit. Therefore, to commit Fornication, is to sin against your own body. (1 Corinthians, chapter 6.)
